entry.title: Symphyotrichum kentuckiense (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Symphyotrichum kentuckiense (flower head pictured), the Kentucky aster, is only found on limestone cedar glades and limestone roadsides in Alabama, Georgia, Kentucky, and Tennessee?

entry.title: Jarn Mound (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jarn Mound was erected to view the "dreaming spires"?

entry.title: Popcom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the external models of the Popcom modem have no status lights, instead providing feedback to the user through touch tones?

entry.title: Shaw Loo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Burmese scholar Shaw Loo was Bucknell University's first international student?

entry.title: The Sims 4 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Sims 4 by Maxis started as an online multiplayer game, but was transitioned to a single-player experience following the negative launch reception of SimCity in 2013?

entry.title: Concerto for Piano and String Orchestra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Concerto for Piano and String Orchestra was described by its composer, Alfred Schnittke, as sounding like a "blues nightmare" at one point?

entry.title: Dujanah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that background research for Dujanah included interviews with Muslim apostates and a Scottish veteran of Afghanistan?

entry.title: Zhang Jiebin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chinese physician Zhang Jiebin believed that tobacco smoking was good for health?
